page.title: 06THE GEOGRAPHICAL ENVIRONMENT
page.content: THE AREA LIES ON THE SUBURBAN FRINGE OF NORTH BELFAST AND INCORPORATES A RESIDENTIAL AREA WHICH IS PART OF THE COMMUTER ZONE OF THE CITY AND A RURAL AREA WHICH IS PART OF BELFAST'S GREEN BELT. THE RESIDENTIAL URBAN AREA IS SERVICED WITH GOOD ROAD COMMUNICATION. THE REMAINDER OF THE "PATCH" IS MADE UP OF MARGINAL FARM LAND ON THE LOWER SLOPES OF A SOUTH EASTERN FACING EXTENSION OF THE ANTRIM PLATEAU, RISING TO 210 METRES IN THE CARNTALL HILL ON THE NORTH WEST AND 270 METRES IN THE KNOCKAGH MOUNTAIN IN THE NORTH EAST. IN GENERAL THE LAND IS GENTLY SLOPING WITH SEVERAL RIVERS FROM A WATERSHED TO THE NORTH AND FLOWING INTO THE THREE MILE WATER, THE MAIN RIVER OF THE AREA. IT ONCE LINKED AND FED THE MILL DAMS OF MOSSLEY AND MONKSTOWN.
